content.raw:
On second thought, this conflates the functionalities of control through `kp_velocity` and joint damping, it might not preserve behavior .  Setting `kp_velocity` to 0.0 actually results in 0.1 Nms/rad joint damping plus `kp_velocity` of -0.1 in the PID update unless we do something more complicated.

If we are indeed allowing teams to change joint damping coefficients, it's be better to keep this issue separate from control and create a ROS service call, allowing setting joint damping dynamically with reasonable bounds per joint.  As implemented in pull request #248.  This will prevent breaking existing control code as one should be able to recover existing damping coefficients.
